comp3111

Class LineMessenger

  • java.lang.Object
    • comp3111.LineMessenger

  • @Component
public class LineMessenger
extends java.lang.Object
    A class which handles sending messages to customers via the LINE push API

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LineMessenger()

    • Method Detail

      • resetCounter

        public static void resetCounter()
        Reset the counter, which counts how many messages our LineMessenger sent

      • getCounter

        public static int getCounter()
        Counts how many messages have been sent since the last call to resetCounter()
        Returns:
        how many recipients have received a message since we called resetCounter()}

      • sendToUser

        public boolean sendToUser(java.lang.String custLineId,
                          java.lang.String text,
                          boolean keepTrackOfSent)
        Send a message to a customer
        Parameters:
        custLineId - The customer's line ID (not the human readable one, but the one used internally by LINE's push API)
        text - the content to send them
        keepTrackOfSent - increment the static variable count, which tracks how many people got the message
        Returns:
        true or false, depending on whether the message was sent successfully (200 OK)

      • sendToOffering

        public boolean sendToOffering(Offering o,
                              java.lang.String text)
        Send a message to everyone in an offering
        Parameters:
        o - The offering whose customers you would like to notify
        text - The text to send them
        Returns:
        True or false, depending on whether all customers in this offering were notified successfully. Note that for customers who don't have a line ID (i.e. walk in customers), we ignore them

      • sendToTour

        public boolean sendToTour(Tour t,
                          java.lang.String text)
        Send a message to everyone in a tour
        Parameters:
        t - The tour whos participants (which span many offerings potentially) you want to reach
        text - The text to send them
        Returns:
        True or false, depending on whether all associated users successfully recieved the message

      • sendToAll

        public boolean sendToAll(java.lang.String text)
        Send a message to everyone
        Parameters:
        text - Content to send to every known customers with a line ID
        Returns:
        true or false, depending on whether every message was sent successfully (ignoring customers who don't have line iD)

      • respondToQuery

        public boolean respondToQuery(java.lang.String custLineId,
                              java.lang.String query,
                              java.lang.String answer)
        Respond to a NonFAQQuery
        Parameters:
        custLineId - the target recipient customer's line ID
        query - what they asked
        answer - what the employee answered via the web interface
        Returns:
        true or false, depending on if successfully sent
